summary: Automated security vulnerability scan detected 9 vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies of the core package beta 18, with the highest severity being 7.8 (CVE-2021-43138 in async library). The issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable dependencies were removed from the inventory.
userImpact: Users of the SDK were potentially exposed to security vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies used in development and documentation builds.
rootCause: Outdated transitive dependencies in webpack-dev-server, cli-table3, mdx-loader and other build/dev tools contained known CVEs including prototype pollution and ReDoS vulnerabilities.
proposedFix: Upgrade vulnerable dependencies: async to 2.6.4 or 3.2.2, ansi-regex to 5.0.1 or 6.0.1, trim to latest, node-forge to patched version, minimist to 1.2.6+, nth-check to 2.0.1+, and got to 11.8.5+.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable libraries were no longer part of the inventory, indicating they were updated or removed from dependencies.
keyQuote: This issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library in the specific branch(es) was either marked as ignored or it is no longer part of the Mend inventory.
